articles.title: NTU scientists develop sweat-powered battery for wearable devices - CNA
articles.description:
SINGAPORE: Scientists from the Nanyang Technological University (NTU) have developed a sweat-powered battery, capable of generating enough energy to operate commercial temperature sensors.

The prototype battery, which measures 2cm by 2cm, only requires 2ml…
articles.content:
The battery is created by printing ink that contains silver flakes and hydrophilic poly(urethane-acrylate), which function as the battery electrodes, onto stretchable fabric.

articles.title: Asian finance sector lacking sustainability leaders: study | News - Eco-Business
articles.description: Consumers in Asia Pacific believe that financial services brands are not supporting sustainable development in emerging markets, and are less trustworthy than tech or car brands, a BBC study suggests.
